biolockj.util

Class TaxaUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.util.TaxaUtil

  • public class TaxaUtil
extends Object
    This utility helps work individual Taxa names, not full OTU path files which need OtuUtil.
    Taxa files containing sample taxa counts for a given taxonomy level as output by BuildTaxaTables.

      Extract taxonomy names at the given level from all given OTUs.
      static TreeMap<String,TreeMap<String,Integer>> getLevelTaxaCounts(TreeMap<String,TreeMap<String,Integer>> sampleOtuCounts, String level)
      Return TreeMap keyed on Sample ID, each sample maps to an inner map(taxa, count).
      Input param sampleOtuCounts contains OTUs for which many can share the same level taxonomy assignment.
      For example if sample42 contained the following 3 OTU values: phylum__Actinobacteria|class__Actinobacteria|order__Actinomycetales|family__Actinomycetaceae|genus__Actinomyces 1000 phylum__Bacteroidetes|class__Bacteroidia|order__Bacteroidales|family__Porphyromonadaceae|genus__Barnesiella 500 phylum__Bacteroidetes|class__Bacteroidia|order__Bacteroidales|family__Porphyromonadaceae|genus__Parabacteroides 77 The phylum level output would contain entries: TreeMap(sample42, TreeMap( Actinobacteria=1000, Bacteroidetes=577 ) )

      • REPORT_TAXONOMY_LEVELS

        public static final String REPORT_TAXONOMY_LEVELS
        Config List property: "report.taxonomyLevels"
        This property drives a lot of BioLockJ functionality and determines which taxonomy-levels are reported. Note, some classifiers do not identify "species" level OTUs.
        Options = "domain", "phylum", "class", "order", "family", "genus", "species"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SPECIES

        public static final String SPECIES
        One of the "report.taxonomyLevels" options: "species"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TAXA_TABLE

        public static final String TAXA_TABLE
        Included in the file name of each file output. One file per sample is output by the ParserModule.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • findUniqueTaxa

        public static TreeSet<String> findUniqueTaxa(TreeSet<String> otus,
                                             String level)
                                      throws Exception
        Extract taxonomy names at the given level from all given OTUs.
        Parameters:
        otus - TreeSet of OTUs in ParserModule format
        level - Config."report.taxonomyLevels"
        Returns:
        Ordered TreeSet of unique taxonomy names
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getLevelTaxaCounts

        public static TreeMap<String,TreeMap<String,Integer>> getLevelTaxaCounts(TreeMap<String,TreeMap<String,Integer>> sampleOtuCounts,
                                                                         String level)
                                                                  throws Exception
        Return TreeMap keyed on Sample ID, each sample maps to an inner map(taxa, count).
        Input param sampleOtuCounts contains OTUs for which many can share the same level taxonomy assignment.
        For example if sample42 contained the following 3 OTU values:
        • phylum__Actinobacteria|class__Actinobacteria|order__Actinomycetales|family__Actinomycetaceae|genus__Actinomyces 1000
        • phylum__Bacteroidetes|class__Bacteroidia|order__Bacteroidales|family__Porphyromonadaceae|genus__Barnesiella 500
        • phylum__Bacteroidetes|class__Bacteroidia|order__Bacteroidales|family__Porphyromonadaceae|genus__Parabacteroides 77
        The phylum level output would contain entries:
        1. TreeMap(sample42, TreeMap( Actinobacteria=1000, Bacteroidetes=577 ) )
        Parameters:
        sampleOtuCounts - TreeMap(sampleId, TreeMap(OTU, count)) OTU counts for every sample
        level - Config."report.taxonomyLevels"
        Returns:
        TreeMap(sampleId, TreeMap(taxa, count))
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getTaxaByLevel

        public static TreeMap<String,String> getTaxaByLevel(String otu)
                                             throws Exception
        Return a map of the given otu parameter split by level.
        Parameters:
        otu - OTU path value
        Returns:
        TreeMap(level, taxa)
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getTaxaLevels

        public static List<String> getTaxaLevels()
        Method ensures taxonomy levels are returned in descending order from top to bottom.
        Returns:
        configLevels

      • getTaxaLevelSpan

        public static List<String> getTaxaLevelSpan()
                                     throws Exception
        Return taxa levels from top to bottom level, including in-between levels not configured as part of "report.taxonomyLevels"
        Returns:
        List of taxonomy levels
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getTaxonomyTableFile

        public static File getTaxonomyTableFile(File dir,
                                        String level,
                                        String suffix)
                                 throws Exception
        Create File object of a taxonomy table at the given level, with the given suffix, in the given directory dir.
        Parameters:
        dir - Target directory
        level - Taxonomy level
        suffix - File suffix
        Returns:
        Taxonomy Table File
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getTaxonomyTableLevel

        public static String getTaxonomyTableLevel(File file)
                                    throws Exception
        Extract the table taxonomy level from an existing taxonomy table file.
        Parameters:
        file - File Taxonomy Table
        Returns:
        Taxonomy level
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • initTaxaLevels

        public static List<String> initTaxaLevels()
                                   throws ConfigNotFoundException,
                                          ConfigFormatException
        Set taxonomy levels ordered by level, from highest to lowest. Require "report.taxonomyLevels" property. Accepts only valid options: "domain", "phylum", "class", "order", "family", "genus", "species"
        Returns:
        List of ordered taxonomy levels
        Throws:
        ConfigNotFoundException - if "report.taxonomyLevels" is undefined
        ConfigFormatException - if "report.taxonomyLevels" is defined, but does not contain any valid taxonomy levels

      • isTaxaFile

        public static boolean isTaxaFile(File file)
                          throws Exception
        Check the file name to determine if it is a taxonomy table file.
        Parameters:
        file - File to test
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if file is a taxonomy count file
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur
